runs.comm: gets forward to a ball on middle and defends solidly
this ball is on middle and leg turning down, beats the flick and hits the pad, rolls away fine
backs away and cuts a short ball on middle attractively but can't beat point
this is flatter on leg and he wristily flicks it away behind backward square into the deep
stuck in the crease there as he ends up guiding a good length ball outside off to cover
kept a bit low outside off and beat Amla's attempted cut after backing away, similar bounce for the slow bowlers in the women's curtain-raiser earlier
full ball on leg and it is squeezed out to the side of the pitch, they scamper through
drives a half-volley outside off down to mid-off standing fairly deep
seam and swing away from the bat there outside off, Levi's flat-footed poke made no contact
full outside off and Levi bullies it through the covers without great timing
Amla slices a ball on off over the heads of the fielders in the inner ring and it races away to the cover fence for the first boundary of the series
this is a good length ball on middle and it seams back in sharply to hit Amla high on the back leg
on leg and played straight to mid-on
again on the pads from around the wicket and clipped through square leg
Levi heaves a full ball on middle out to deep midwicket
rocks back after seeing this was slightly wide of off, cuts in front of square on the off side through the gap and out to the boundary
this is fired into middle and leg at 106kph and Amla wristily flicks it through square leg
comes down the track and inside edges a heave to a short ball outside off into his pads
that is an extraordinarily flat six over the rope at extra cover, he gave himself some room and got underneath a half-volley outside off and just launched it with the minimum of fuss

goodness me, Martin Guptill has done a Jonty Rhodes to South Africa, Amla had played it down the ground at the bowler, who stuck a foot out. Amla decided to run but it had dribbled close to the stumps where Guptill swooped in and carried the ball along with his body weight right into the stumps with Amla out of his ground
Levi counter-punches with a bottom-handed shovel to a half-volley on middle and sends it packing over the square leg fence
totally misdirected slower ball which ends up as a loopy full toss outside off but Levi can't capitalise as he slaps it straight to cover
tries to bang it in on off but it sits up, Levi goes for the hook, doesn't time it all that well but he still gets it to the square leg boundary on the bounce
this was a slider going straight on, Ingram the leftie gets an inside edge into the pads which saves him

waltzes down the track and the length isn't full enough to go through with the loft over mid-off, Ingram makes no contact and Brendon McCullum is surprised by the amount of turn past the bat but eventually lays enough hand on ball to knock the bails off
this is pushed through outside off and AB tries to guide it without moving the feet and misses
on leg and driven straight to mid-on

this is closer to off but AB again tries to dab and misses, he drags his foot out of the crease for a fraction of a second and Baz whips the bails off, it goes upstairs and AB appears to have a millimetre of boot behind the line, a tough call but the benefit has to go with the batsman there
and starts with a ball fired in at 137kph, beats AB's flick and hits the pad, they take a leg bye as it rolls away

Southee has clocked Levi on the helmet with a nasty bouncer on off, Levi was on the front foot trying to pull and watched it sail over the blade into the grille, Southee exchanges some words with the batsman but I don't believe he was checking on Levi's welfare
bad ball down leg but Levi can't get it past fine leg and they have to settle for a single
full ball on off is dug out down the pitch
on-drives without much power towards Doug Bracewell and AB was out by miles if the throw had hit, the running has exhibited early signs of kamikaze tonight

this is slightly slower than usual as Southee rolls the fingers across it, it pitches on leg and Levi tries to scoop it over the long-on boundary but never gets hold of it and it settles safely in Bracewell's grasp
short on middle and leg and he stays back to work to long-on
JP waits in the crease and drives elegantly off the back foot to the cover sweeper
full on middle and leg and AB gets forward to drive towards long-on
again goes back and cuts a ball close to off into the deep
slightly short on middle and off and AB pulls without the best of timing to the midwicket sweeper
JP gets forward to defend, gets an inside edge which rolls away to leg, Nathan runs across to do the fielding off his own bowling
goes back and cuts it through the infield into the deep
AB gave himself a touch of room, Southee tries to bang it in at 142kph and it is short outside off and beats what Richie Benaud would have called a windy woof
punched away in front of point
Southee again tries to bang it in, moves back in sharply but Duminy gets on top of the pull and mistimes it into the gap at midwicket
waits in the crease and works a ball off middle towards the edge of the circle at midwicket

another short ball on leg and JP hooks down to fine leg in the air, Mills appeared to have a chance of catching it but took it on the bounce, he was possibly rendered sightless for a moment there by the sun
full on leg and clipped away square
short outside off and he forces it away using the bottom hand through cover
slightly short down leg and tucked fine, Bracewell rushes in to prevent a couple
gets forward on leg and defends down the pitch
short outside off and he mistimes the cut to point

brilliant by Guptill! It was full outside off and AB absolutely slammed it low to short cover, where Guptill took it cleanly and made a difficult catch look extremely simple. AB asked Guptill whether he caught it and accepted his word, but the umpires went upstairs to check. After numerous replays memorable only for their inconclusiveness, the umpires finally send AB on his way.
outside off and Duminy is gliding it through the slip cordon down to third man
strays on the pads and clips it away behind square
short on leg and he pulls it down to fine leg
strays down leg, zips back past the flick into the pad and it rolls away
full on the pads and he flicks it out towards cow corner, they push for a second and the third umpire is called upon but he is in by a fraction as Guptill did the bowler's job and broke the stumps
full toss on middle, comes down and slaps it out to cow corner
this is well outside off and he comes down and across and whips through midwicket
short outside off and he goes back and cuts into the deep
slowed up slightly on leg and tucked fine
full and wide of off, Duminy mistimes the drive towards mid-off and that lack of timing allows them to easily complete the run
goes back and whips a good length ball on middle through midwicket
misdirected waist-high full toss outside off and Duminy plays it down towards point, sets off and beats the direct hit comfortably, New Zealand's fielding has been top-notch so far
wristily works a full ball on leg straight to midwicket
short outside off and Ontong bottom edges the pull through backward square
nicely times the cut to a short ball outside off but sends it straight to the cover sweeper
slow down leg and he can't connect with the pull, gets hit on the body
this is a good length ball on middle and leg hurrying Duminy back into his crease, chops it down into his foot

that was close, it slid on after pitching on middle, hit him low on middle and leg, that looked to be hitting but not given, the replays indicate it would have hit the stumps, lucky escape there for Duminy
swept away through backward square, one short called
almost chips back a return catch, it was full and he popped it back to Nicol who could only get it on the bounce

gets down to sweep, looked to have got glove on it, went up the arm and shoulder and popped up behind the stumps where Baz dived brilliantly to take it one-handed, appeal turned down, that was a difficult decision for the umpire
smeared away through square leg
worked into the covers
comes down the track and heaves a ball outside off across the line and over the boundary at cow corner
full toss and Ontong makes it two in two, slaps it flat over the rope at his favourite cow corner
this is fuller outside off but it doesn't matter, Ontong goes for three in three and gets it, sends it sailing into the stands at midwicket
four sixes in the over turn the innings on its head, charges down the track and Williamson is helpless as Ontong pumps him into the stands at long-on, 26 off the over
full outside off and Duminy wisely drives into the off side and takes the single to give Ontong the strike

but Ontong is another to fall victim to brilliant fielding! This time it's Southee off his own bowling, he got a leading edge back down the pitch and Southee dived low and forward to snaffle it two-handed inches off the ground
full toss on leg is whipped away towards cow corner as Albie Morkel opens his account
short outside off and it sits up and Albie heaves it towards cow corner, wills it to go over the rope but it gets to long-on on the bounce
very wide outside off, outside the wide lines, Duminy reaches for it and gets a fortuitous bottom edge past Baz and down to the fence at fine leg
opens the face on a full ball outside off and eases it through cover
in the blockhole outside off and he jams it out towards mid-off
poor full toss wide of off which gets the treatment, slaps it through the covers and to the extra cover fence
slower ball outside off defeats Morkel's heave to leg
again a slower ball outside off and again Albie tries to swing to leg without success
inside edges into the pad and it drops on the crease, Duminy urges Albie through and they make it comfortably
full outside off and he drives to long-off
innovative and creative from Duminy, walks across and paddles a full toss on off over the head of fine leg, got a decent chunk of blade on that
Duminy gives himself some room and with a hint of deliberateness, he slices the square drive over the infield and out to the point boundary
drives straight to cover and has to put in the sliding dive at the non-striker's end to get home as the throw is wide
Albie hammers a full ball outside off towards the cover boundary, the fielder does very well to grab it one-handed and cut off the four

Duminy top-edges the attempted hoick high into the sky and Mills at fine leg hangs back waiting for it and eventually has to dive forward and clutch it millimetres off the grass, he is relieved at hanging on
Albie swings a full ball on off between backward square and fine leg using the inside half of his bat
short ball which hits Botha on the arm and chest trying to pull, drops down near the stumps and Botha rushes through at the urging of his partner
Albie jams out a yorker on off, rolls behind the stumps, Baz is quick to prevent any runs
Albie has been looking to swing over wide long-on all night, yet again he doesn't connect as he slips it wide of off
digs out a full ball on off through the covers
141kph short ball outside off which zooms past Botha who barely has time to attempt a stroke
full toss on the pads but Botha can't get it away, hits the pad high and it rolls away from the fielders
low full toss outside off which he smears flat down to long-on
well executed yorker from Mills in the blockhole, jammed out into the off side
slower ball outside off and Botha gets enough bat on the paddle scoop to get it over the fielders on the edge of the circle at fine leg
Botha gets across a touch and sweeps a ball outside off with a hint of paddle and times it very well as it races through square leg

dropped over the boundary for six, but it is harsh to say that as Botha got under a half-volley outside off and launched it towards the long-off boundary where Nathan McCullum dived full stretch but could only parry it over the rope
reverse sweeps the final ball straight to third man
